cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles south of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: slowly edging west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then expected to curl north and northeast inland over SE Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Matagorda Peninsula–Freeport area, TX

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: middle and upper Texas coast including Freeport, Galveston Bay, and Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 45–60 mph winds with higher gusts likely as the center passes very near or over Freeport.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft possible in and around Freeport and Galveston Bay, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with locally higher totals, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents that can hamper vessel operations and port access.
